skill.name: claude-chrome
skill.description: Claude in Chrome - browser automation via the official Anthropic extension. Control your logged-in Chrome browser, automate workflows, fill forms, extract data, and run scheduled tasks.
skill.summary: Claude in Chrome - browser automation via the official Anthropic extension. Control your logged-in C...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation (SKILL.md) describing browser automation capabilities. No executable code is present. The skill describes integration with the official Claude Chrome extension and Chrome DevTools MCP server, both of which are legitimate browser automation tools with documented security controls including site-level permissions and confirmation prompts for high-risk actions.

content.value_statement: Manual browser tasks take up too much time. This skill enables Claude to control your Chrome browser, automating repetitive form filling, data extraction, and workflow tasks using your existing logged-in sessions.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to URLs and manage multiple browser tabs
Click buttons, type text, and fill out web forms automatically
Extract structured data from web pages and save as CSV or other formats
Access authenticated pages in Gmail, Google Docs, Notion, and CRMs
Monitor console logs and network requests for debugging
Record browser workflows and run them on scheduled intervals
limitations: Requires Google Chrome specifically (other Chromium browsers not supported)
Requires paid Claude plan (Pro, Team, Enterprise, or Max)
Cannot operate in headless mode with the extension (DevTools MCP supports headless)

use_cases.title: Test Web Forms
use_cases.description: Automate form testing with invalid data and verify error messages appear correctly

use_cases.title: Extract Web Data
use_cases.description: Pull product listings, prices, and availability from authenticated web pages

use_cases.title: Automate Data Entry
use_cases.description: Fill CRM records or spreadsheet data into web forms automatically

prompt_templates.title: Basic Navigation
prompt_templates.scenario: Visit a website and click elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to [website] and click on the [element description]

prompt_templates.title: Form Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Open [URL], submit the login form with invalid data, and check if error messages appear correctly

prompt_templates.title: Data Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to [page] and extract the [data fields] for each item. Save as CSV.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Step Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Open my [service] at [URL], find [item], and [action] using my logged-in session

output_examples.input: Go to github.com/anthropics and click on the "Code" tab

best_practices: Use fresh tabs when pages become unresponsive to avoid getting stuck
Be specific about elements and actions to produce consistent results
Add verification steps for long tasks to confirm all items were completed
anti_patterns: Using browser automation for one-click tasks that are faster to do manually
Leaving CAPTCHAs or modal dialogs unhandled during automation runs
Running automation on pages with dynamic content without waiting for elements to load

faq.question: Which browsers are supported?
faq.answer: Only Google Chrome (latest stable) is supported. Brave, Arc, Edge, and other Chromium browsers do not work.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Rate limits depend on your Claude plan. Pro plans have lower limits than Team or Enterprise plans.

faq.question: Can I use this with other MCP servers?
faq.answer: Yes, Chrome DevTools MCP can run alongside other MCP servers in your Claude Code configuration.

faq.question: Is my browsing data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The extension uses Chrome Native Messaging API locally. Site permissions control access. High-risk actions require confirmation.

faq.question: Why is my browser not responding?
faq.answer: Check for blocking modal dialogs (alerts, confirms, prompts). Dismiss them manually or restart the extension.

faq.question: How is this different from puppeteer or playwright?
faq.answer: This uses your real logged-in Chrome browser with existing sessions. No re-authentication needed. More convenient but less isolated than headless browsers.
